comments:
Define an attribute invariant via OCL:
self.propertyName>=0

If this property has the type EInt everything is fine and the Validation action in a GMF editor works as expercted.

But if the type of the property is changed into ELong, one gets a 'Validation action failed' message with the following stack trace:

java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Integer
at java.lang.Long.compareTo(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.emf.ocl.expressions.impl.EvaluationVisitorImpl.
    visitOperationCallExp(EvaluationVisitorImpl.java:1054)
at org.eclipse.emf.ocl.expressions.impl.OperationCallExpImpl.accept
    (OperationCallExpImpl.java:274)
at org.eclipse.emf.ocl.query.impl.QueryImpl.evaluate(QueryImpl.java:242)
at org.eclipse.emf.ocl.query.impl.QueryImpl.check(QueryImpl.java:278)
... 

The problem is, that Java type Long is not mapped to the OCL primitive type OCL_INTEGER in org.eclipse.emf.ocl.expressions.impl.EvaluationVisitorImpl. visitOperationCallExp()!

OCL Integer type should be implemented by Long.
This bug should be set to RESOLVED since the problem was fixed in bug #198451 (https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=198451).
Thanks, Andreas, you are correct.  You have anticipated my end-of-the-week cull of outstanding bugzillae!
